messages.title: Standing up for Poplar & Limehouse
messages.content: I'm proud to have represented and lived in Poplar & Limehouse, focusing on the issues and people who need help the most. This is a great place - I don't want to see it damaged by cuts to our services or a Tory-driven 'Hard Brexit' that will wreck our economy. I am committed to our area and understand the concerns and ambitions of those who live here. Whether I am fighting for affordable housing or to keep our GP and hospital services open, Poplar & Limehouse and its residents are at the heart of everything I do.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Stand up against a Hard Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The decision to leave the EU has already been settled by the British people, but oppose Theresa May's approach and her not-so-hidden agenda to turn Britain into a low-wage tax haven for big business.
The Conservatives will further run down the NHS. Only Labour will protect and nurture our NHS, and will always fight to save local services under threat.
I have campaigned hard in parliament for leasehold reform to end unpredictable or rip-off charges.

issues.brexitEurope: Stand up against a Hard Brexit, oppose Theresa May's approach to Brexit, consumer rights as well as the rights of EU citizens currently living in the UK.
issues.economy: Stronger economy, fighting for local people and helping create the opportunities we need to prosper.
issues.health: Stand up for our NHS, protect our NHS and local health services, Keep our NHS safe

community.content: I will continue to help local people in need of better housing, work with the local council to build affordable homes and stand up for renters and leaseholders being ripped off.

leaflet.personalStatement: I hope I can count on your support on Thursday 8 June to continue working for you.

endorsements.endorsement: "Jim will fight for our services. Better education, safer streets and good healthcare for all. I'm proud to have him as our MP but we need him back in parliament to keep standing up for us."
"If you need something done for your family or the local area, go to Jim. He'll continue to keep his promises and work hard for us, like he has done for the last 20 years."
"Young people like me would be the most deeply affected by the acrimonious split with Europe the Tories are pursuing. We need Jim and Labour representing us in parliament."

images.caption: Leaving the single market could see businesses in Canary Wharf leave
Together we will protect our NHS and local health services
The many renters with housing issues every month

examples: If you need something done for your family or the local area, go to Jim. He'll continue to keep his promises and work hard for us, like he has done for the last 20 years.
I have campaigned hard in parliament for leasehold reform to end unpredictable or rip-off charges.
I will support tenants and leaseholders, support the building of affordable homes and work to improve local social housing.
